text: Very laid back environment,  they treat you like grown folks! I just wished that the tanning bed was accessible 24 hrs , I work 3rd shift and I sleep during the day, other than that it's an awesome and convenient place

resp.text: happy to see those 5 stars! Thanks for giving our gym some love! 💗

name: James Joyce
text: Exactly what the sign says. Workout Anytime isn't as big or well-stocked as Tiger Iron Gym, but it is cheaper and generally has everything a no-nonsense lifter could want. The $39 "rate guarantee fee" is a bit sleazy and truly nothing more than a delayed signup fee, they're short a couple 20kg barbells (there's a couple random 15kg ones that float around between racks), and the barcode scanner out front is a little janky, but everything works, you get 24-hour access, and the membership being good at other locations is cool. Another set of dumbbells might be good. This is *not* Planet Fitness in every way that matters, and that's a damn good thing.

resp.text: Thanks so much for the positive review! Your health & wellness is important to us – and we appreciate your support 💪

name: Brian Likins
text: Best gym in town perfect size and location, you could not ask for a better staff that’s always willing to help and constantly learning their self. Clean equipment and bathrooms. Keep rocking it guys!

name: Tina Burner
text: Best Yoga Studio I have ever been too! They are the most welcoming people I have ever been around. I never felt out of place & they always provided such a pleasant experience.

name: Alison Herlihy
text: Glow is an amazing community! They have a great variety of classes and the classes can be accommodated for all fitness levels. When I first went to Glow, I was a little intimated by hot yoga, but now I am a believer.

name: Jackie Hawkins
text: I love this place. Easy going, no pressure, no problems. I can easily plan times to go around my busy schedule thanks to the 530a classes. A lot of other yoga studios in the area I looked at didn’t have weekend, night, or early morning classes which always made it difficult to try something new.  I haven’t found an instructor I don’t like and I love the special events                (especially the ones that they partner with other businesses). I really look forward to continuing with Glow.

name: Danelle Adair
text: When I decided to join a yoga studio, I looked local studios around town and when Glow Yoga popped up, I knew this studio was the right one for me. The good vibes I felt when I stepped into the front door confirmed how I felt when I saw the website. The teachers are so friendly, knowledgeable, and make classes fun. Namaste Glow Yoga family. ✨🧘🏻‍♀️✨

name: Marbury Buckhaults
text: From the first moment I felt a part of the Glow family and yet we are given that gentle shove needed that produces results. Can't say enough good things!

name: Jacquelyn East
text: Glow Yoga is a very welcoming studio. You can practice here at any level. When I first started practicing yoga at Glow, I was a beginner. It has been a wonderful journey to watch my practice grow and my body become stronger. No more back problems.

name: Emilee Shuler
text: From my very first day at Glow Yoga Mobile, I have felt completely welcome and comfortable. Soon after starting classes there, I began to realize that this place is not just a yoga studio. It's a safe place where like minded people can go to practice yoga, but also a community in which everyone supports and encourages each other. I enjoyed it so much that I began the teacher training, and it is one of the best things that's ever happened to me. I'm not only learning the physical aspects of yoga and how to teach it, but how to incorporate it into my day to day life. I am learning so much about myself and life in general. I could go on and on!

name: Melissa Byrd
text: Having tried many yoga classes, I never really felt connected to the practice or the classes until I began going to Glow Yoga.  I entered feeling very intimidated but left with a sense of community and peace.  The studio and the staff are so welcoming and inspiring.  I began practicing here at a very vulnerable time in my life having faced many terrible tragic losses, yet due to the constant positive energy, I was hooked.  I am now teaching yoga and thriving both on and off of the mat!  I cannot thank them enough for changing my life, one breath, one hour at a time!

name: addie hanson
text: Such an awesome environment--I am brand new to yoga and everyone was so welcoming and helpful! Can't wait to go back and finish my 30 days for $30 special. They also have an awesome selection of workout gear including Lululemon (so cute!!)

name: Gail Harrington
text: Changes your body and your mind .I feel stronger after every class.The instructors are so encouraging and positive. For me, it's a great way to end a stressful day.

name: Jacqueline Beverly
text: Original location is in Gulf Shores, AL, but the Mobile studio has the same welcoming, friendly, and relaxed vibe. You will get a great workout for your body and mind! Plus, they sell Lululemon!

name: Kristin O'Connell
text: Judgment-free, all skill levels welcome and super happy environment. Love Glow Yoga so much!

name: Jennifer Heitman
text: Best Lululemon selection in southern Alabama. If you love Lululemon, you should definitely check out this studio. Great location in Springhill. Stay for some amazing yoga too!

name: Tara Brown
text: I love Glow yoga!! Great people and wonderful yoga!!

name: Rachel Fulmer
text: Perfect Location with a great community!

name: Cinna buunnzz
text: Love it!

name: SJ Donahue
text: I really had high hopes for this camp and do think that overall it is good.  We became a little frustrated as summer camp went on, that they require DAILY extra cash of $5.  That really ends up becoming quite expensive on top of the initial price, I can't imagine having multiple kids there!  While I think the occasional field trip is fun for a change, I felt like some times this was used unnecessarily.  This information was also not told up front, but after signing up in the paperwork required.  Extra money for field trips, snacks, pizza parties, gas for the vans?!, etc.  Honestly, this is what changed our mind from doing the After School Program.  Also keep in mind the After School Program change: initially they said there would be homework time, Jiu Jitsu/tumbling/gymnastics practice, and an active game (we thought, perfect, not on devices!).  This has now changed to field trips again with daily fees and less emphasis on JJ, with no word of homework time.  It's basically 2-2.5 hours, why are multiple field trips expected???  Again - overall good, I believe they are trying, but I think they have moved away from some of the initial appeal of these programs.

resp.text: SJ! Thank you for your honest feedback! We strive to improve our programs on a daily basis!! Randall

name: Mike Fetsch
text: Staff is awesome and really cares about your individual experience. Learned teachers means a wide variety of techniques taught. Facilities are great, and everyone is inclusive and friendly.

resp.text: Thank you sir! Randall

name: Colin Mitchell
text: I’ve been training BJJ here for years. Gym atmosphere is very positive, and all management and instructors are very professional. Staff and members go out of their way to make newbies feel welcome. Couldn’t recommend more!

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words!! Randall

name: Amie Brown
text: My son loves this summer program! It's amazing to be able to go to work with the peace of mind that my son is in good hands and having so much fun!

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words!!

name: Jackson Swartz
text: Very friendly and inclusive staff, it’s a fun way to stay active.

resp.text: Jake!! Thank you!! See you tonight 7 pm no gi bjj at aumma!! Randall

name: Eric Bohanan
text: I absolutely love this place! Great atmosphere and training environment. The staff and instructors are all super helpful and welcoming. The people going are all great. Only been going a short time and I’ve already learned a lot!

resp.text: Thanks Eric!! Randall

name: Alexander Adolf
text: Auburn BJJ is exactly what I was looking for in a BJJ gym. Very knowledgeable MMA instructions with a great emphasis on technique, practice, and discipline, while keeping it fun. All of the coaches, owners and members keep a family atmosphere and culture in the gym that allows you to feel comfortable to ask questions, trust each other and build friendships quickly. I highly recommend Auburn BJJ.

resp.text: thanks!!!

name: Andrew D'Amico
text: Dropped in for a class while visiting Auburn. They were awesome. Great instruction and fantastic culture. Had a great time and will definitely drop in again when I’m back in Auburn...War Eagle!

resp.text: Thank you sir!!

name: Clinton Lothrop
text: You're welcome, it is a very nice well run gym and community. I am happy to have discovered it.

resp.text: Man, thanks!!!

name: Jack Hamersky
text: Unbelievable staff that instill in their business what they practice on the mat. The level of understanding and flexibility for families is unparalleled. Excited to get back at it in the fall.

resp.text: Oh man! thanks for the kind words! We miss seeing ya'll!

name: Nikki Richardson
text: My kids have really enjoyed their experience here so far. We hope to continue going here for many years to come. The teachers are great with them! My oldest is 8 he’s learning a lot and so interested in it. He’s very shy but learning to open up more.

resp.text: Thank you so much!

name: Nathan White
text: Great family atmosphere, where everyone is working to help you succeed.

resp.text: Thank you sir!!! Randall

name: Ciarra S
text: For our son's 3rd birthday in June, he said he wanted to be like a ninja turtle. The best we could do was sign him up for Jiu Jitsu. He has been in class for about 3 weeks and loves it! I feel like he is learning so much and he is excited to go every day. He loves his instructor and says that "Ms. Raven misses him" on days he does not have class. She is very patient with him. So far, we love it!

resp.text: Thank you so much!

name: Jesus Perez
text: It's a place where strangers become like family, everyone helps one another get better and progress as one. My 5 year old also loves it and he just started. Hopefully my wife follows us too! Everyone should definitely give it a try.

name: Hoffman Rhyne
text: I've been a member here for about 3 years.  I had no previous experience in martial arts, but Randall, Steven and the other staff are great instructors.  Now I only attend the open mat times and we all help each other keep improving.  It's not only a great place to learn BJJ, but also to make some solid friendships.

resp.text: thanks buddy!

name: Patrick Morgan
text: If you are looking to change your life, get in great shape and have fun while doing it, become a member of Auburn Jiu Jitsu. You will not find better instructors who care about you as an individual. I have been a member for nearly 3 years and my one regret is that I didn't start training Jiu Jitsu earlier. So, what are you waiting for. Make that phone call or drop by and get started today!

resp.text: Thanks Patrick!!!

name: Kounte Threadgill
text: There are many reasons why I would recommend Auburn Jiu Jitsu but the two most important reasons are the dedication and patience of all the instructors. They really do want to help your child learn and become an outstanding individual on and off the mat. My son started here over a year ago and his self confidence has grown tremendously. I would tell anyone that this is most definitely the place to be!

resp.text: Thank you so much!!

name: Nathan Southerland
text: Randall and the staff are amazing! It doesn’t matter your ability they work with everyone to help them learn and enjoy Jiu Jitsu. Starting your journey here is a great decision.

resp.text: Thanks Nathan for the kind words!

name: Paul Medina
text: While I was a student there I greatly enjoyed it. The staff was nice, the lessons interesting and a good overall atmosphere. However, the issue I have is their handling with billing and cancellation of memberships. I sent them multiple emails asking to have my membership cancelled yet I received no reply. I have called them multiple times and left voicemails(because, for whatever reason no one picks up) but there is no return of my calls. I even called and talked to Randall, the owner, who said he would make sure to do it. He did not. They proceeded to charge me despite no longer attending and having asked to be cancelled multiple times.

name: Scott Cleveland
text: Great school! I have seen my sons confidence grow as he progresses through the belts, and have no worries about his ability to fully defend himself.  Kids Mid level package breaks down to around 20 one hour classes a month (5 a week) at ~120$, That's 6$ a class. Hands down, the best money  I have ever spent.

resp.text: Thanks!!! We have great kids and parents!

name: John Stokes
text: Mr Randall and Steven are great instructors. Very friendly and knowledgeable. Awesome environment to train in.

resp.text: Thank you sir

name: David Bostic
text: Randall and the rest of the instructions are great. I highly recommend getting your children signed up and training.

resp.text: thank you sir!

name: Shengkai Xu
text: This place is a big family, everyone is helping me to get better.

resp.text: Thanks!!

name: Jon Jordan
text: This is a great Gym for anyone looking to start jiu jitsu or develop your game to a higher level. Everyone is super friendly and contribute to the clean, family friendly environment. As a jiu jitsu practitioner of 10+ years I really appreciate the depth of knowledge Randall has and his willingness to help others progress. Always a pleasure when ever I can train here.

resp.text: Thanks Jon!! Always good to see you!

name: Jenny Pope
text: My daughter is really enjoying classes here and having such a positive experience!

resp.text: Thank you so much for the kind words!

name: Lori Duck
text: Greatest role models for your children!!  The staff becomes family. Best investmentment we have made for our daughter to instill self confidence, agility and mental strength.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the kind words!!!!

name: jesse savage
text: i have been training there for four or five years great place for both Brazilian jiu jitsu and Judo

text: Excellent family atmosphere for adults and children.  Great instructors and grappling!

resp.text: Thanks!! It's our students that make it awesome!!

name: Randall Plaisance
text: The instructors and the culture here are exactly what we need more of in this world. Great program for kids, adults, men and women.

name: James Ernst
text:

(Original)
Dinka dinka doh

resp.text: wow! thanks!

name: Brittany Hook
text: I love Fit4mom! I've never been the type of person to workout and stick with it, but I've been with Fit4mom for almost 2 years! I love to have been able to workout before, during and after pregnancy. I love how the instructors work with whatever stage of life you're in! My 5 year old loves the playgroups and has made so many new friendships, and so have I! I recommend Fit4mom 100%!!

name: Michelle Schmitt
text: Consistently working out on my own has always been a challenge. A friend invited me to my first class almost two years ago. I've been with them ever since. Fit4Mom Madison offers different classes at different times of day to accommodate the busy mom life. Moms are supported at all stages of motherhood. There are fun Mom Nights Out and play groups to help build community. They partner with local businesses and are growing to make exercising more accessible. I am very grateful to have found them.

name: Stacey Roy
text:
I joined Fit4Mom Madison while on maternity leave with my youngest over four years ago and I can't get enough! Fit4Mom Madison is for EVERY mom through every season of motherhood, pregnancy and beyond. I wish I had Fit4Mom through my pregnancies and other children's baby years.
Workouts are for every skill level, with knowledgeable instructors to help guide and modify as needed. Classes range from early morning solo time to stroller classes with kiddos to evening virtual classes.
This is a no judgment, safe space with amazing mamas. Build relationships and friendships. Give your kids the opportunity for socialization and learning at play groups. Do something for you by going to workouts without kids. Enjoy Mom Nights Out, Book Club, and give back through various charities Fit4Mom supports throughout the year to help meet local needs in the community.

name: Ashley Jacob
text: Stroller Strides classes are one of my favorite activities to do with my kids. The classes are so welcoming to everyone and it is so nice to be able to have a conversation with another mom while going through the workout. My kids also enjoy going to playgroup after class.

name: Maggie Butler
text: I LOVE Fit4Mom. It’s truly not just a workout, it’s an entire community of friends that hold you accountable. Forever thankful for this amazing group!

name: Rebecca Eagly
text: I love everything about Fit4Mom Madison and am thankful every day that I found this group 18 months ago. The owner, all the instructors and fellow mamas are so welcoming and supportive. There are moms at all different fitness levels and at all stages of motherhood. I actually cried after my trial class because I felt so reassured and validated. There are lots of different classes offered on all different schedules, and they are as challenging as you need them to be. I always leave feeling like a million bucks. But F4M is much more than an exercise group. They host playgroups, mom's nights out, book club, run club etc; and everyone just genuinely cares for each other. I highly recommend F4M Madison and only wish I'd found them sooner!

name: Brianna Fannin
text: I am so grateful for FIT4MOM Madison! I was nervous when I was pregnant that I would not be able to find an inclusive group of mamas to share triumphs and struggles with as I entered into motherhood. Not the case with FIT4MOM Madison! This community of mamas supporting one another is just what I was looking for and it is more than just a workout. You can connect with others at mom's night out, book club, crafts, and so much more! I cannot recommend FIT4MOM Madison enough.

name: Kathleen Burns Bauman
text: As a new mom in a new town, Fit4mom has been a life saver. The owner, instructors, and other moms are so welcoming, encouraging, and positive. It's so much more than a workout,- it's a sounding board, mental refresher, and social interaction that I so deeply needed. Everytime I leave a class I feel so much better, both physically and mentally.

name: Sarah Preston
text: The equipment is great. Peter, one of their trainers, is fantastic. The tanning beds are high quality. I gave four stars instead of five because cleanliness could be better and now that summer has hit, it has been pretty hot in there.

name: P Johnson
text: My adult daughter has been at this gym 6 months and loves it, so I wanted to check it out.  The first thing I noticed is the easy access to the facility with plenty of parking.  The gym is well-lit and I felt the energy as I entered.  The front desk folks are friendly and helpful, engaging in conversation with those who have questions and offering a friendly greeting to those who just want to check in and get started. The ladies' locker room is clean and fresh smelling.  The gym is clean and organized.   Staffed 24/7.  A supervised activity area for children...  I can see why my daughter likes to be a part of this Crunch Fitness.

name: Nicholas High
text:
Management is super unprofessional. They don’t pay their staff enough to care. No commission, so the staff have no incentive to raise a finger, but they’re really great people. Plumbing is always down, from the sinks in the bathroom, to the water fountains. What gym, in the biggest city in the state, can’t fix a water fountain? It’s a cheap gym, and a good value for the money, but the management is so rude to both employees and staff that I felt bad paying the membership fee every month.

They “bought” a bunch of memberships from Gold’s Gym, and charged those people $30/month without their consent though, so what do you expect?

There was a guy caught taking pictures of women changing in gym down the street and the manager decided he could get a membership at Crunch for whatever reason, even as criminal charges were pending. Not what I’d consider to be great decision-making.

name: Jourdan Truth
text: Love the gym! It’s clean and the staff are friendly and make sure the gym stays neat! Also love that I can keep up with ESPN and the news while working out with all the TVs. Here for all the gains!

name: Christine Gaitantzis
text: Had a great experience at Crunch. It is spacious and clean with a lot of variety in terms of workout machines and options. Staff was friendly and helpful.

name: Earth & Sky
text: Excellent facility and staff was great! Much cheaper and more amenities than all other local gyms. Definitely worth the wait!!

name: Kenneth Enman
text: Go see Johnny and Kayla for a great gym experience.  Convenient location and nice mix of weights, machines and cardio eqipment.

name: Gator6
text: Great gym! Had a day pass, lots of diverse equipment! Nice people!

name: April L. Butler
text: Awesome new facility, tons of space and courteous staff.  2 floors of workout space, group fitness, and the best spin instructor to boot!  Really great gym, especially considering the price.

name: Christina Buchholz
text:
Great facility. Nice people. Reasonable pricing. Love the hydro massage.

Subpar children center.

name: Johnny Isbell
text: The best energy I have ever felt in a gym hands down. Tons of equipment and the staff is always friendly and helpful. Way cleaner than any other gym I’ve been to as well.

name: Lauren Muncher
text:
Wow. Just wow. Going back to planet fitness!

I went as a guest of a friend and I was not impressed.

An employee named I think Johnny, was super unprofessional and wasn’t wearing a mask during a GLOBAL PANDEMIC! He was rude to other staff and clients. As someone who has been in customer service for over 10 years I was appalled. He ignored clients and spoke down to women! This is 2021 for god sakes. Leave the misogyny in the 50’s.

The only redeeming employee was a blonde girl (I think her name was Emma or Emily?) she was awesome and I hope she finds a better place to work!

Planet fitness here I come!

name: Pamela Cartright
text: My trainer is excellent . The gym is mediocre. And the there are mistakes with billing.  If you are overcharged do not expect to be reimbursed.

name: Melvin Smith (Snap)
text: It’s a great place to workout and the prices are low! You can’t beat that.

name: Kaiser Hulsman
text:
I worked here from July-October 2020, if any customer saw what was going on behind the scenes of this place it would make them sick to their stomachs. Often times the GM and Owner would short people money on their pay checks and it was up to us on the staff to harass and remind them for days at a time to get the money we worked for. It wasn't just front desk staff either, the personal trainers were shorted even more money and would even be shouldered out of it. Finances aside the environment of continuous disrespect towards the employees was a daily challenge. As a male I did not have to deal with the sexist name calling but i did have to deal with inappropriate conversations about the female members who would come in and work out(From GM).
Very unprofessional, disrespectful and not a good work environment.

name: Abdul D
text: The gym is very good. Super clean! Everything you need for working out is available. Even when it’s crowded, I still can get the workout done. Friendly staff. And 24 hours.

name: Ken Sutherland
text:
Well equipped and a shiny new facility.
I didn't see many cleaning stations. Odd showers don't have soap or shelves. Good prices for memberships though!!!

name: Carlo Romano
text:
Don’t ignore the bad reviews. Golds was wrong, after being dormant, to then sell memberships, personal information and data - and yes, they sent emails. So what. Some didn’t get them, some had contracts that expired, and some weren’t even active members when they decided to go bankrupt and hide from their already unmanageable debts.....
If you’re  happy at Crunch - great. But I find the practice of charging people that don’t want to go to your gym, even worse. What’s even more frustrating is the manner in which Crunch (Hoover) acts about it. There is never a reason to charge anyone before communicating such. They had a golden opportunity to be the good guy and decide everyday, and at every interaction to be the opposite.
Our country is hurting right now - businesses have all the reasons in the world to be helpful right now and those business that don’t understand that - should be shamed!
Cancel Crunch

name: Laqhasha Reed
text: Because Gold's sold my membership without my knowledge or consent and because Crunch started billing me forty bucks without warning, my  bank account was overdrawn by $60.  If Crunch would have bought the Gold's location I would have considered staying. However, thank goodness I'm relocating to another city.  They should remember that prosperity without integrity will never work out in the long run.

name: Johnny Molden
text: Don’t listen to all the bad reviews because of Gold’s mistakes. I was a Gold’s member too, and with just a little communication the folks at Crunch easily adjusted my membership to their plans—which actually had more benefits for less money than what Gold’s was charging! Sadly with covid cases spiking again I needed to ask about cancellation (I have a high risk child at home), but was worried that I’d technically still be locked in my old contract from Gold’s. Again, nope, no issues-no questions asked and no pressure. I look forward to doing business with Crunch again in the future and will recommend them to anyone who asks.

name: Emily Stephens
text:
IGNORE THE ANGRY GOLDS MEMBERS

When golds shutdown in march, I received multiple emails explaining my membership would be transferred to Crunch. I contacted crunch before they opened and they provided my new billing date information and confirmed my account. They were incredibly helpful.

Since it opened, the facility has been well maintained. The classes are high energy and fun, and the equipment is top notch. They listen to their members and got more accessories for the different stations, as well as more benches. I see staff constantly cleaning and refilling the bottles at the cleaning stations. Tanning and the hydromassages are nice perks too.

While this gym hit some rough spots after opening (hydromassage and tanning beds going down), the staff has been incredibly apologetic and to resolve all issues.

I've visited this gym during different times on different days and some staff that deserves recognition includes Krissy (a manager), Arkin, Nick, Landry, a tall dark haired girl, and many others.

This place is awesome and they're doing the best they can with mess golds left them with.

name: Bradleigh Smith
text: This gym is so well laid out and has ALL the amenities you could be looking for!!! The staff is super friendly, shout out to the front desk boy nick who always is looking good! There is all the top of the line equipment, classes like cycling and yoga and there is also a hydro massage and tanning bed/ spray tan areas. Overall very pleased with my experience!!!!!

name: Marlin White
text: Very clean, spacious, and offers a lot

name: V P
text: Never been inside a crunch gym but have been charged for membership since July 2020. While many families were struggling financially during Covid-19, golds and crunch gym found a way to steal money legally from people. Doesn't matter how many emails were sent out by either gym this was calculated by both parties, they were in it to steal money there are no if and buts about this. What crunch did was buy stolen goods,  they wont admit it and point finger at golds for selling membership but can't take responsibility for being a part of the transaction. Crunch might be a great gym but they took advantage of people and tried to gain business by cheating members.

name: Saba Arain
text: It has everything you need + a great atmossphere

name: Sleepy Hollow Review
text: I have been to Crunch everyday since they opened and love it. Extremely clean and well lit. Tons of equipment and classes. The instructors seem pretty knowledgeable. In my opinion, the 1 star reviews are from people that are from Golds. Crunch bought all of Golds memberships when Golds closed. This is a common business practice. Should they have called, maybe but Golds could have as well.

name: Duncan Lawrence
text: A wide variety of equipment to use with plenty of floor space so you don’t feel like your right on top of other people.

name: Eli Brown
text: I am a former Gold's Gym client and was getting personal training at Gold's in Pelham.  I stopped personal training BEFORE Gold's shut down.  Nevertheless, Crunch charged my credit card a total of $285, $230 of which was for personal training, and I had never set foot in their gym. I never gave them permission to charge my credit charge. I couldn't care less what arrangement Gold's and Crunch Fitness made. I just know I never gave Gold's permission to give my credit card information to anyone, and I never gave Crunch permission to start charging my card.  When I called, they refused to refund my money and said they had a right to continue charging because they had bought the memberships from Gold's. I tried to explain to the lady that I had stopped personal training even BEFORE Gold's shut down.  Needless to say, they did not refund my money. Crunch Fitness in Hoover is perpetuating a fraud, plain and simple. I suggest all former Gold's Gym members who had drafts on their credit cards immediately check their statements. Crunch is outright stealing!!!! Believe me, they will not stop until more of us file fraud complaints against them.  Stay away from this gym.  STAY FAR, FAR AWAY!!!!

name: Lindsay Diaz
text: Crunch classes are so good. The teachers all give options which helps me!

name: Molly Feazell
text:
This gym billed me 8 TIMES what a single membership is from my transfer from Gold’s and WILL NOT refund a penny!  My membership was SOLD to Crunch Fitness when Gold’s Gym pulled out of Alabama.  A membership signed in 2004.  Never updated, never renewed.  The e-mail from Gold’s was vague at best about Crunch and the process to PREVENT said charges. I checked to see when an opening date for Crunch was & there was not a date listed till just before their opening in June.  I joined another gym 2 years ago so my husband was the ONLY ONE using the Gold’s Membership!  I like everyone else, was unaware my credit card had been charged till my July statement, FOR A FAMILY MEMBERSHIP!!!
Their lack of conscience and GRAB at money during this time to open & stay afloat is appalling!!!  This type of treatment by gyms is why they go out of business so quickly.  Good luck to anyone who joins & don’t misstep you agreement because you WILL NOT get any money back.

name: Bryan Nations
text: Great place to workout.  Actually feels like a gym instead of a social gathering place.

name: Brandon Lee
text: COVID cesspool. Almost no one takes masking or social distancing seriously, including some of the employees. It's also very difficult to get a spot on any of the racks or benches because there are just so many people crammed in over there. Only one stall to change clothes in in the locker room. Very limited space for laying out a mat and doing body weight exercises. There are plenty of cardio machines though.

name: Hannah Perkins
text:
For a business who's motto is "No contracts!" they seem to care a lot about not trying to cancel the contracts (even outdated and expired ones)  that they buy from other businesses.

This is an honest review so I'll start with the Pros because it's not all bad at Crunch. Crunch is a good deal if you are paying Crunch prices. It's a bad deal if you're paying Gold's Gym prices (which can be double or triple the highest tier Crunch membership available)

Crunch Pros:
- Cheaper (but I had to fight them to lower my monthly rate since they tried charging the Gold's Gym rate)
- Lots of cardio machines
- Open floor plan and lots of hand sanitizer/paper towels/cleaners
- Tanning
- Free Day Lockers (no personal lock needed, just use a 4 digit code)

Crunch Cons:
- Bought contracts from Gold's Gym and never sent an email to say when they opened (I only noticed I had gotten a charge from them and figured out that way.)
- Very difficult to leave if you were from Gold's Gym (You have to go in person. My friend tried to cancel 3 times by phone and still got charged his Gold's Gym rate which was double the highest Crunch rate.)
- App still doesn't work for Gold's Gym transfers (This means transfers from Gold's Gym can't sign up for group fitness classes online. It's been at least 3 months and this still hasn't been fixed.)
- Gold's Gym was cleaner (Crunch commonly has used paper towels shoved into the cup holders of most machines -- GROSS)
- More crowded than Gold's Gym
- No space for more than 1 or 2 people to use floor mats

name: Bernard Garrett Serota
text:
I hate the negative reviews this facility is getting!!!! It’s a major upgrade from the Collonade Gold’s Gym. I was also a transfer membership and the last email Gold’s sent out made it VERY CLEAR that they sold my membership to this new gym (including billing info). If people are mad, they should be mad at Gold’s. They had months to be responsible and check up on what we were informed was going to happen.

And this facility is awesome, very clean, and available 24/7, with a wide range of classes and accommodations. Totally worth it.

name: Jared Buckmaster
text: Like alot of people here was charged 39.99 without my knowledge after golds closed. I was told golds sent emails letting people know what was done, and I wouldn't be getting a refund. To think the only reason I found this was because they are opening one in Alabaster and I was interested in joining so i was looking at reviews and pictures of other clubs.. I'll drive by everyday  on my way to 24e.

name: Phillip Bryan
text: This is more about the corporate side. The local staff seemed very courteous and nice. I was a member at golds gym colonnade which was shutdown due to COVID then subsequently closed all Alabama locations.  Apparently they sold my information to crunch fitness hoover without my knowledge. Though crunch and golds claims they sent an email on 04/21 acknowledging this transfer I did not receive this email. Also I never received any contact from crunch fitness about my “new” membership. I also looked back at the previous time I was a member at crunch fitness tuscaloosa and received on average 5 emails a month from them, so why the silence on the 3 months I was a “member”?

name: Thomas Little
text: Im not a salty Golds Gym former member. Here’s a real review. Very clean, very friendly staff, membership fees are reasonable for what ya get. They have far too much cardio equipment and very minimal free weights! Honestly I’m being generous with the 3 stars but the price is right. It’s just a drastic change coming from Lifetime! This is not the place for a serious lifter!

name: Brandon Matthews
text: Can't beat it. Great prices, clean, tins of equipment and amenities.

name: Willian Benitez
text: It is 🔥 👀 🙌 😎  omg if thinking of joining a gym go to crunch is dope tons of weights cardio and whatever you wanna do

name: Jack Robertson
text: Workout here a few times a week.  All new equipment and super-clean.  Staff is really friendly too!

name: andrew traywick
text: Shoddy business practices. Crunch says they purchased my account from another gym that had closed. First I heard of them was when I tracked them down through a 3rd party payment processing company due to charges they auto drafted from my bank. Seems a business operating in good faith would have contacted me to let me know I had a membership with them. When I called, they didn’t care. They gave me a legal statement and asked if they could apply the charges towards a membership with them now? No thanks. They refused to refund me anything, so I filed a BBB complaint. Hope others do as well.

name: Jeff Padgett
text: Disregard all of the laughable neg. Reviews from former Gold's members.  Coming from gold's  myself, I can attest there were 3 emails - w from Gold's  and 1 from Crunch in April...the later CLEARLY outlined how to cancel.  It is not fraudulent nor unauthorized  when those people signed a contract  with Golds that  allowed transfer in the eventvod closing.  Maybe they should spend the time being more responsible and less whining about something  that occurred only because they were too irresponsible to check their emails...especially  with the knowledge Golds was closing.  Grow up people.

name: Ken Hoover
text: Crunch began auto drafting my account without my permission after supposedly transferring my membership from the former Gold’s. There was zero notification given nor authorization for these transactions. After contacting them, they simply refused to refund my money!  They told me to contact Gold’s to dispute, even though they are out of business!

name: Rusty Redford
text: Horrible business.  They did not hesitate to take $80 out of my account without my consent or even knowledge of a membership transfer from Golds.  They refuse to make it right and it is indicative of how they will do business in the future.  It is absolutely ridiculous.  No way can this place be trusted.

name: Drake Tyner
text: I was charged 35.00 dollars without my knowledge for months. Golds gym went under due to Covid they sold my membership to a close gym Crunch. I was not told, I just happened to look at my regions account where I noticed a charge of 35.00 from ABC*Crunchftn. I had to do some research to find where the charge came from. Once I found out I called crunch told them there was fraud on the account. They informed me that golds had given them the membership. I asked for my money back because this went on without my knowledge. They told me no the money could only be added to account funds at there gym. Then they asked me if I was interested in a membership with them after they took my funds without my knowledge. Livid I told them I’d never join there gym. They took money from not only me but a lot of others who went to golds. I know I’m not the only one. This should count as a huge black mark on crunch fitness.  They could have asked if I wanted a membership there or sent me an email. But instead they just charged every previous golds members account and refused to give it back.

name: Kevin Laws
text: Crunch began auto drafting my account without my permission after supposedly transferring my membership from the former Gold’s. There was zero notification given nor authorization for these transactions. After contacting them, they simply refused to refund my money!  They told me to contact Gold’s to dispute, even though they are out of business!  The word here is theft.

name: Teri Jones
text: This gym began charging me three months after Gold’s Gym closed. I did not sign a contract with Crunch Fitness nor did I give them permission to charge my account. They are located no where near my home or work. I have joined another gym and I’m paying membership fees at that gym. When I call, they tell me they will have someone call me back but they never do. This is extremely unprofessional and should be illegal.

name: dave Chapman
text:
Made fun of me when I could only do two push ups. Cut the lock off my locker and someone stole my epi pen.
Went into diabetic shock near the waterfountain and was left there because everyone thought I was planking.

name: Dylan Nolan
text: I was a former Gold's Gym member when COVID-19 hit, and Gold's Gym said they would transfer my membership over to this Crunch Fitness once it was opened. I never received any correspondence from Crunch Fitness about when they would open or when they would start charging for memberships. They instead just decided to charge me for 2 memberships without notice, and even though I contacted them the day after I noticed the $70 charge, the manager insisted that it was impossible to give a refund. When I asked if I could contact someone higher up who could give me a refund, she claimed that she did not know how to contact her boss. This company used sneaky, underhanded tactics to take money from families who are already struggling during a pandemic. HORRIBLE BUSINESS.

name: Rick Massingill
text: Was charged a monthly fee on my credit card for a gym I do not belong to. Upon calling they informed me they bought Gold’s gym membership list which is now closed and I have not been a member of in quite a while. When I requested a refund they said there was nothing they could do and would not refund my money. Sounds like a bunch of crooks to me, run as fast as you can away from this place.

name: Joshua Grant
text: Without any correspondence, Crunch started taking $36.99 out of my account without my consent. Once I spoke with the manager, Krissy, she told me that all of the Gold's Gym members were automatically switched over to Crunch, and placed on a re-occurring monthly fee. Krissy refused to refund the money back to my account and told me to contact Gold's Gym (which is permanently closed in Alabama). Super unprofessional. I wouldn't recommend this gym to anyone.

name: Kyra Marie
text: It's very clean and ventilated well and they seem to be following all covid-19 restrictions etc. The front desk staff is typically friendly!

name: Lance Pierson
text: Very friendly, location is always clean, and has everything that I need.\ for my workout.

name: Keith Franklin
text: Apparently Golds sold my membership and information to crunch. No effort was made to ask if I wanted to be a member. Crunch just started autodrafting from my account and refuses to refund. Very poor business practices on both Golds and Crunch’s part. I will never step foot in another one of their gyms.

name: Rob Ashline
text: Crunch Fitness is fraudulently charging $40+ a month on my account when I have not set foot in their gym, nor have I signed paperwork; and I have not given them permission to use my banking information. They received my account information because Gold’s Gym sold my account to Crunch Fitness, which is an unsavory business practice for both companies. Will not be doing business with either company any further.

name: c p
text: Great variety of machines, and equipment.

name: Antonio Smith
text: Love this place.

name: Tanya Ray
text: I cancelled my membership at Golds Gym before Crunch Fitness bought the accounts from Golds Gym.  Crunch fitness charged my account and doesn't know if I can get a refund? I ask for someone I can speak to in the next 24 hours to resolve this and see about getting the refund, they don't know if there a corporate number or anyone else to contact. So you just decide to charge people for a service they never asked for and won't issue the refund??

name: Gracie Smith
text: Friendliest staff! I’ve had nothing but positive experiences here!

name: Almas Ghaziani
text: so far so good

name: Dalton Patty
text: Started charging me a re-occurring $40 fee for a gym membership for a gym I’ve never stepped foot in. Woman on the phone told me they received all of golds gyms prior members (and signed them up for a re-occurring payment without any sort of notification or consent). Shame on golds gym and crunch. Sounds like a potential lawsuit waiting to happen.

name: Kimberly Vega
text: My husband and I were on an account together at Gold's gym.  I emailed Crunch to let them know I did not want to join.  They cancelled my membership but not my husbands and have been using my debit card info to bill my account for a total of $155.  When I called crunch they told me that I was supposed to cancel them separately because they don't have family memberships at Crunch.

name: James Baker
text: Absolute scam artist stay away will absolutely rip you off will be contacting the better business bureau

name: TJ Cameron
text: Beware of the contract with this gym, as well as and most importantly Gold's Gym.

name: sean clark
text: Awesome

name: Doug Roberts
text: Great gym

name: Anthony Day
text: Great gum. Lots of variety. No profanity.

name: Will Taylor
text: Love the atmosphere here! Great gym with some great folks!

name: Wes Janiszewski
text: Trained here while I was in town for a day was very impressed when I walked in. Great atmosphere and equipment

name: TC Gurus
text: Lane is a great person and his staff are highly motivated to help you with nutritional and physical fitness. Congrats Lane... you've come a long way since the old flood ridden building you started in. 😉

name: Logan Smith
text: This place is a good place to get fit or ripped and get e swell workout without being interrupted. They close at eight on moat days and they close at 12 pm on Saturdays they're not open on Sundays.

name: jennifer thornton
text: Great little gym with lots of equipment.

name: Jennifer Thornton
text: Great gem of a gym in Citronelle

name: darla brewington
text:
(Translated by Google) Expwnsive

(Original)
Expwnsive

name: deborah coker
text: My kids love attending Chung’s.  This program has given them confidence they use day.  Great family atmosphere.

name: Greg Sharpe
text: One of the most amazing martial arts centers I have seen.  Its about family!  They teach more than martial arts.  They teach everyone self-discipline, courage, confidence and best of all Master David Adams and his instructors pour their heart into every second of instruction.  Don't miss out!

name: Tom Salter
text: The instructors work with each student to support their strengths and the areas that need improvement. They emphasize focus, respect and honor. My nephew has not only learned to set and meet goals, he is having a blast doing it. There are classes for children and adults with knowledgeable and caring instructors.

name: Jeremy Davis
text: Chungs has always been a great place to learn.I started in 4th grade in the late 80s in Montgomery.I Met new people made new  life long friends and participated in tournaments.And learned from great instructors and students.

name: Michael Thomas
text: Great place great staff my daughter loves it!

name: James Wells
text: Great place for work out and the staff are excellent

name: Katelyn Brownfield
text: I've been taking lessons here for the past 5 years, and it has positively improved my life. Its a great place to train and make new friends!

name: Maurice Fitz-Gerald
text: If you want results this is the place to go. I am 65 and in great shape thanks to this gym.

name: Shuji Miller
text: Stayed in Birmingham for vacation and needed an affordable gym to work out at. I was only there for 3 weeks so the 1 month no contract plan was great. My friend also was with me for just 3 days and it was $5 for a drop in visit so extremely affordable. The gym is family owned so the it’s not 24 hours, but the time worked fine for me on vacation. Closed on Sundays. The staff was extremely welcoming and friendly and we had a wonderful experience. The equipment is a little bit old, but it was much larger and more extensive than I thought it was based on pictures and other reviews. They have plenty of equipment, the free weight area was great, and a great open spot for HIIT and cardio training. My one critique would be the age of some of the equipment and lack of water fountain (they sell water for $1 per bottle though) but being a smaller family owned business, I understand equipment can get pricey, especially during Covid. Great experience though and will be back anytime I visit Birmingham.

name: Stephanie Lee
text:
This is the greated gym ever!  Went to my first class after 4 months of virus shutdowns.
Trudi is an excellent and knowledgeable instructor.  I had such a wonderful time.  Iron Beach Gym is a the place to be!!!

name: Dylan Fallin
text: Great classic gym, one of the best I’ve ever been to in the USA 5$ fee. You’re not going to get a classic environment like this anywhere else in the us. I stop by every time I travel with work

name: Brice Bishop
text: Amazing local gym. Nothing fancy and no frills. Old school gym.

name: Anita Cook
text: I get a great workout in classes with Trudi! She is very caring and a wonderful Christian.

name: Barbara Swader
text: Trudy is an excellent teacher. Works with each of us on our problems. Gives a good work out for Seniors. Recommend the gym highly.

name: Justin Horn
text: Iron Beach Gym is a smaller gym, but that's the great thing about it.  Everybody knows everybody and they're not afraid to help spot on a lift or offer suggestions on form.  I've only been a member for about a month and, thanks to all the help I've received, I've seen huge improvements already.

name: Charolette Tarwater
text: Seems busy, but I only drive by as I shop next door. The "E" word is not in my vocabulary. I even joined band in high school to get out of having to take gym...lifelong nerdy aversion to the "E" word. Lol

name: Archie Blackmon
text: Great place to get a workout in.

name: T “Lady T” CL
text: Owned by a Christian couple doing wonderful things.

name: Robert Thompson
text: Locally owned very nice place

name: Quincy Murray
text: Great place

name: G
text: Great place

name: Sharon Murphy
text: Short cut home.

name: Josh Laning
text: Great

name: Truth and Justice
text: Great place to work out. Low montly cost and great child day care. Lots of amenities and friendly staff!

name: Joseph Pullen
text: Closed now; but was an excellent gym.

name: Tracy Mac
text: Great Gym great leader ship at the top in the owner...

name: Miguel Hernandez
text: Great gym, but  needs better hours

name: shawn caine
text: Best around......

name: David
text: No longer in business.

name: James Morgan
text: Great atmosphere

name: Mildred German
text: Home!

name: Varina Hart
text: I have been at the Inverness OTF since Feb and I love everything about it! The coaches are helpful, positive, and enthusiastic. The staff is upbeat and ready to answer any questions or take care of anything you need. The workouts are challenging and push me. And I love not having to think about what to do for my workout--everthing is laid out when you get there so you just focus on the routine for that day as the coach leads you through it. And the music is fun and upbeat. I have NEVER been a proponent of gyms, I would rather do my own thing at home but not anymore! I am hooked!

name: Celina Leggiere
text:
This place is an absolute scam! It is actually kind of sad, because my fiancé and I really did love the work out, the classes, and the coaches! The experience overall was ruined by the front desk administration staff! my fiancé and I joined this as a part of getting in shape before our wedding next year! When we signed up we made very clear what the fees were and etc.

We had some complications with changing our cards over! For example, at first my card was on the account and then we changed it over to my fiancé‘s card! (We had to fix this 5 times because the front desk staff could never get it right!) There were multiple times where we were having problems booking classes because the people that had taken our card information and supposedly switched it did not save/submit it to their system!

Later to find out, they were charging us random charges! These random charges were repeat charges of our memberships repeat charges of 12 and $15. It got to be so bad they were charging us all throughout the months that our bank called us and told us that it was suspicious activity and that they were going to ban orange theory from charging us. we then tried to get in contact with the owner to give them a chance to make it right because we loved it so much! And she was very rude and did not do anything in her power to make it right. When we asked her what the charges were for she couldn’t tell us the exact things that the random charges were for, which was SKETCHY!

In addition to this, it is very hard to book classes! We were always on a waiting list! And it we didn’t feel like we were getting our money worth! I got so bad that we would try to book classes while we were there in person and sometimes the front desk staff would say that we’re booked for weeks ahead of time and we weren’t!

Orange theory is a great work out overall and we saw great results! But this location is not professional, does not care about you or your finances, and they are extremely rude when they mess up and you confront them. I will add that me and my fiancé are members at greystone, and our Greystone membership is less than Orangetheory With all of the charges they were charging us.

name: Hannah Bowman
text: Great first experience! I went to try out the free class and everyone was wonderful from start to finish. The staff were extremely helpful in making sure you understood what to do and that you weren’t over whelmed.  After the class a staff member went over pricing options and everything else you’d need to know! I’ll definitely be back soon.

resp.text: Thanks for the 5 star review, Hannah! We’re so glad you enjoyed your experience with us. Can’t wait to see you in the studio soon!

name: Tami Barnes
text: I LOVE Orangetheory Fitness!!  Chris is my favorite trainer but everyone is great!  They push you to do your personal best.  I feel very comfortable here and not judged.  I work at my pace and comfort zone.  But because the coaches are so good....you don't WANT to slack!   I recommend this gym to everyone!

name: Nicole Strickland
text: The absolute best workout you'll ever have! The workouts are different every time, which I love. The coaches and staff are incredible and the studio is super clean. I'll be a member for life!

resp.text: Thanks for the 5 star review, Nicole! So happy to hear you’re loving your OTF experience! Can’t wait to see you in the studio again soon.

name: Shellie Sullivan
text: I love the intensity and push from the trainer and the energy that comes from working out in a group. It really helps me stay determined and go further than I think I can.

resp.text: Thanks for the 5 star review, Shellie! We’re so happy we can keep you motivated, and give you the extra push. See you in the studio!

name: Carla Rice
text: Coach AK is ah-mazing and the entire staff is extremely pleasant. Best place to workout and you will see results, if you’re dedicated.

resp.text: Thanks for the 5 star review, Carla! We love Coach AK too! See you in the studio.

name: jackie reed
text: Very good experience from start to finish.

name: Maggie Grisetti
text: This has been the best workout experience that I have been a part of.  I have done a one on one personal trainer in the past and even that did not compare to this.  Having others in the class give me the push that I need to do my best, but it is still a small enough group that I get help when I need it.  The coaches are excellent at keeping the energy up in the group and encouraging everyone to do their best.  This is one workout program that I will be doing for a long time!

name: Joe Riner
text: By far the best workout I have ever had! The coaches are amazing because they make the classes fun and energetic. I have been with them for a month and I already have seen incredible results. As soon as you enter the facility you are greeted by name. I would absolutely recommend this to everyone!

name: Ivan Ardan
text: Great workout experience! Heart rate monitor feedback gives you a very efficient workout. Challenging workout but fun because of the technology and environment/group culture. Very nice staff too. Scheduling classes keeps me accountable = I'm working out more often and getting better results in the 1 hour compared to working out alone.

name: Amy Sehulster
text: I had an AMAZING coach! Rachael was great at pushing me to do even more than I thought I could myself. I loved the music and the fast pace of the class. I burned so many calories and got 33 splat points!! I can't wait for my next class.

name: Kristen Barlok
text:
It’s a workout that kicks your butt...and every other part of your body 😜...but also somehow makes you want to come back for more!

The workouts are well-planned, challenging, and diverse, the trainers are motivating, knowledgeable, and spirited, the heart rate monitors give you something to strive towards, and the music helps create the vibe to keep you going when you think you can’t.

I love this place!  I actually look forward to going, and miss it when I’m not there.

resp.text: Hi Kristen! Thank you so much for the positive review! We're thrilled that you love our coaches and our versatile workouts! Keep burning! We'll see you in class soon!

name: Iris Melara-Guzman
text: The instructors are great. They are all very motivating and positive! I haven’t worked out this hard in a while and it feels good, I don’t think I could have done it on my own. I like that OTF keeps me accountable and makes me want to work out harder each class.

name: Emma Garner
text: Love the work out! However, Orange Theory is still trying to charge me  after I cancelled my account because I moved two hours away. I'm sorry but I though this was all about "no contracts"... I would definitely think twice about signing up.

name: Nanette Barrett
text: I love this place. I’m has high energy  you get a great workout in an hour. Full body and HIT workout. Staff and coaches are great. Expect to sweat. It is a membership place but they do give you the first class free

resp.text: Thanks for the great review, Nanette! We're glad to hear you are enjoying your experience with Orangetheory.

name: Megan Smith
text: It’s pushes me harder than I would ever push myself. Coach Chris is the best coach you could ask for. He gets to know you and your fitness level, and then works with you to achieve your goals. All coaches at Inverness are great, high energy, and willing to help. The front desk staff is always welcoming and very personable. OTF Inverness has made working out an enjoyable experience for me, which has never been the case before.

name: Brittany Burgess
text: I visited this studio as a guest from out of town. Even though it’s not my home studio, the staff was friendly and welcoming. I had no trouble getting booked in and signed in with their help. Coach Nigel was super fun and high energy, and I really enjoyed the music. He was also very attentive and gave great tips on form when I needed some coaching. Coach Avana was extremely motivating, and her energy makes you want to give it all you’ve got. I will definitely be dropping in again at this studio when visiting Birmingham!

resp.text: Thank you for the kind review, Brittany! We're so glad you enjoyed your workout at our studio. We'll let both Coach Nigel and Coach Avana know how much you enjoyed their class. We hope to see you for another work out whenever you're back in town!

name: Emily Warner
text: Such a friendly and welcoming environment! Everyone was so supportive and encouraging before, during, and even after the class! The constant exercise changes mixed with the cardio speed variations make for an intensive and awesome work out!

name: Benjamin Tibbs
text:
Only ever worked out with Coach Chris, so I can't attest to other coaches, but he's fantastic so I will transfer that awesomeness by default.
HEADS UP.
The Birmingham Orangetheory's are SERIOUS about their 6 month contracts. I came from Tuscaloosa (where they let me cancel my 6 month contract mid-contract) and ended needing to cancel and they (Inverness) originally told me that they wouldn't allow me to cancel. However, after talking with the regional manager (Karen, I believe) they worked it out to let me cancel and instead pay the month-to-month rate for the two months I regularly attended.
Bottom line, be informed before signing anything and enjoy the workouts (and results)!

name: Amanda Gilmore
text: Greatest workout ever! The coaches are super nice and knowledgeable.

resp.text: Thank you SO much for taking the time to share your experience with us Amanda! We look forward to being a part of your fitness routine for years to come. See you at the studio!

name: Jennifer Dunn
text:
The workouts are challenging and when the classes worked for my schedule, I loved them. I referred several friends to this business because I loved it so much. The technology is great when it works and allows you to see the calories burned during your workout routine. However, it seems to glitch often.

Administratively, this place is not client friendly. If you sign up for a class but have to miss for any reason (in my case it was always a sick child issue or schedule change), they charge you $10, so it's best to not sign up for classes in advance and just pop in. Also, if you want to cancel your contract, you have to show up in person and tell them that you would like to cancel. Then they have to send an email to their manager letting her know that you would like to cancel. Their manager will then ask for you to come back in and fill out the required paperwork. Therefore, to cancel, you have to make two trips back to the location. Rather than making this a smooth and easy process, they are determined to get you back in once more. Also, the manager has yet to respond to emails questioning this practice. From other negative reviews, it seems as though cancelling a contract is not an easy process.

name: John G
text: Orange Theory has helped me more than any other gym. The coaches are solid. They keep me accountable and keep the classes moving. Every day is different...except that you know you’re going to burn a light meal before you’re done! I went from walking a 5k to being able to run at competitive times. Everyone can choose their pace and use weights that suit them. OTF also provides a community and friendships to keep you coming back.

name: Jeff Brownlee
text: I was traveling from out of town, and stayed at a hotel near this studio. Getting set up to take classes was super easy, and all of the staff made me feel very welcome! It was nice to visit a different studio for a few days and see the little differences, but also have a consistent experience that was very close to the same, making it feel comfortable and familiar. Kasey and Dymon were both great coaches, and Vernon at the desk was as hospitable as could be.

name: Katie Kilpatrick
text: I just started Orange Theory recently to burn for my upcoming wedding. So far, the workout and the staff have been incredible! Starting with day one, I got a call from Chris explaining everything to me about the scheduling and what to expect. Nigel was my first instructor, and he was great! When I wanted to give up, he helped me to keep pushing through. I found my old endurance! On my third visit, I forgot my wristband and Chris went over and beyond to make sure that I had one... he found one that died when my workout started, and he even brought another one to me while I was on the treadmill! Not to mention, I am finally sore and feel more confident... just after 4 classes, I already feel like my best self! LOVE ORANGE THEORY DOWNTOWN!!!!

name: Richard Shea
text: The instructors are great. I can’t get nearly as good of a workout in by myself as I can in the OTF group setting.  The workouts change to always keep things fresh and challenging.  I have an unlimited membership and travel a lot for business, so OTF is great for me. I’ve been to studios in several different states.

name: Brenda Smith
text: I like that all of the staff is extremely helpful and motivating.  Coach Chris has really worked with me one on one with various concerns about my past injuries and current fitness level. Brenda S

name: Sarah Korwan
text: I love the OT workout because it's always different, keeps me moving and never bored. Best of all, I get an incredible workout!

name: Jim Huckestein
text:
Truly enjoy the challenging fast pace workouts that center around high intensity cardio with a good block of core/weight training.  I'm an old man in my 50's and do not have the best knees in the world.  The coaches have been great to provide scaled back moves for high impact knee movements during the workout.

There are lots of class times each day to make it easy to attend.  I would absolutely recommend OT Fitness!

name: Baylee Law
text: Not only are the workouts great, but the staff is great too! Chris (works the front desk) has always been so extremely nice and helpful! Anytime I have a question or concern, he's my go to! I promise you won't regret joining the Orange Theory family!

name: Trea Ladner
text: The management is awful and the facilities are a joke... there’s a toilet in the middle of the manager’s office just to meet building codes! They have no respect for anyone that has anything negative (yet constructive) to say about their operations, and all they want is your money. Just go to a regular gym and save yourself the trouble.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback, Trea. We'd like the opportunity to learn more about your experience at our studio. Please send an email to studio0563@orangetheoryfitness.com and a member of our team will be in touch with you.

name: Jennifer Jones
text: Love Orange Theory!  I have lost a total 30 lbs since I started in December of 2017.  I love the accountability, I love the coaches, and I love the workouts.

name: Lynn Tamblyn
text: Great studio with awesome staff and coaches. A challenging workout every single time.

resp.text: Thank you SO much for taking the time to share your experience with us Lynn! We look forward to being a part of your fitness routine for years to come. See you at the studio!

name: Mary Thomas
text: PLEASE DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME!!! AND THEY KEEP YOUR INFORMATION and CONTINUE TO CALL YOU AFTER YOU ASK THEM TO STOP!!! I am a plus sized woman who has lost a significant amount of weight on my own. A year and a half ago, I tried orange theory for three months.  They do NOT make a band large enough for women with large bust size and for a waist over a size 12. My results were alway inconclusive and it looked at though I had done nothing on the monitor. People in the class were snickering and laughing and asking who this person was. Of course I worked hard if not exerted more work than those smaller than myself but because the monitor does not pick up from under my breasts,  it looked as though I walked and I am unable to tell what I need to work on because of the results. When I explained this to staff, nothing could be done. I tried to cancel this membership also after three months and my career and travel timing wouldn't allow me to get to gym during the beginning month to cancel as they require and in person cancellation. and I tried to explain this, nothing could be done, and I was charged three months that I couldn't attend. I would not recommend this place.  THIS PLACE is for gym heads already fit with something more to prove to themselves. Do not support this place until they become a place for ALL sizes!!

name: Chris Dishon
text: Would give them negative stars if possible. My wife joined and once she realized she wasn't going to be able to make the scheduled classes she tried to cancel her membership. They told her they would cancel it for her and failed to mention that paperwork was required to cancel. Even after submitting the paperwork they still charged us for the next month. I'll be actively discouraging people from going here and would warn anyone thinking about signing up. This is definitely not a place with ethical business practices... Beware.

name: Jeremy Brown
text: Great instructors with a good attitude. Great atmosphere. My instructors are motivating!

name: Chris Pope
text: I love the community atmosphere, the motivation from the coaches, and the simplicity of the concepts. All of these attributes make for a dynamic, but less intimidating environment for all fitness enthusiasts.

name: Judy Hollis
text:
Would not recommend this place to anyone, not even to my worst enemy.  I joined a month to month membership and was told that I can cancel anytime. Joined in May after 3 sessions I had health issue requiring surgery I called in June to cancel but I was told the best is to freeze my account so I did. It cost $15/ month.
However, I was charged $150/ month in August and September. I called to cancel and was told that I still have to pay anther month . This is the worst gyms membership experience I have ever had. Beware!

name: Qtboinbham
text: Went in with an open mind.  Classes were small enough to get a great workout with guidance but not so much where you have someone you feel like criticizing you. Monsters are easily seen. Atmosphere was high energy. Got up to burning over 900 caleries in 1 hour. I felt like I got spanked like a newborn but definitely made me want to go back for more.  Leave phone and distractions in car commit one hour for yourself and let everything else go.  You’ll be glad you did!!!

name: Shelby Davis
text: Friendly atmosphere. No judgement. Quick but challenging workout!

name: Kristie P. LaRochelle
text: Love OTF. They keep men motivated with different work outs each day, there's plenty of flexibility with scheduling and they hold me accountable if I don't show up. WIN!

name: Anthony Washington
text: You will love the personality of the trainers, the variety of the exercises, and most importantly the result achieved from working out at OTF Inverness!

name: Margaret Jay Jessee
text: Everyone at OTF Inverness is helpful and encouraging. I'm sure everyone has a different favorite coach, but all of the coaches are great. They are knowledgeable and energetic. I have enjoyed working out here more than I have in any other gym or class. I joined as a way to build strength for running, and after only a month, I'm seeing noticeable improvement in both my speed and endurance. While it's not cheap, it's actually less expensive than most crossfit boxes, and it's a far better experience for me than crossfit. I highly recommend it for anyone, though those who have little to no experience with exercise will likely take a while to be able to complete all of the workouts in full. The coaches are more than willing to help and accommodate all fitness levels, though.

name: Brittany Murphy
text: Ok, I'm just going to brag about one of my favorite places. 6 months ago, I attempted a workout that I was worried was going to kill me. When I had to fill out the form on the first day regarding my exercise level and weight, I was so down on myself that I couldn't even write down my actual starting weight because I was embarrassed (sorry, OTF Inverness, but doesn't everyone lie about their weight when they're writing it down!) Anyway, after my first class, I was exhausted, but I also loved it! So I decided to give it a month, and after that another month. Now six months in, I can't imagine my life without OTF. I have made friends, dropped weight, and built strength & endurance. My husband jokes that the first rule of being member at Orangetheory is that you have to talk about Orangetheory....lol! Honestly that may actually be a true statement! If you have been struggling with a workout routine and you just want to try something new, check out a class! The first class is free and there is no pressure! The coaches and staff are amazing! You may find something new that you love!

name: Maya Madden
text: Such a fun workout! Avana, Nigel and all the coaches are awesome plus the FOH staff are very welcoming!

resp.text: Thanks for the review, Maya! We're so glad to hear you have enjoyed your workout experience and that our coaches and staff help motivate you towards your fitness goals.

name: Fax Finneycorp
text: great folks. make newcomers feel welcome.  tough workout. just what i wanted

name: Lindsey Justice
text: I've been to several different Orange Theory locations as a travel nurse and this one is by far the worst. I love OT, but the customer service here is pitiful, to say the least. Unfortunately, it was my original "home OT" and as soon as I can get someone on the phone I will not have to deal with them anymore. Will not cancel my membership via email despite their “regional manager” okaying it and still charging my card one month later.  Choose ANY location but this one.  Rude and inconsiderate.

name: Carlie McMillan
text: Great workout!  Motivating coaches that push you personal goal to the max.

name: Chelsea Baker
text: The instructors are all fantastic and it is so much fun! It is probably the most intense workout I have ever done but you see and feel the changes it creates very quickly.

name: Allen Wang
text: hi dear friend,we are factory of produce the fitness equipment.Do you interesting the water rower?

name: Ashley Blumberg
text:
Absolutely worst business ever. Signed up for a two week trial and was told that after the trial, I could cancel. Well, after the fact, they are saying that I had to cancel BEFORE the trial started if I didn't want to pay for a full month.

So - they charged me for the full month. But - it gets even better.

They promised to refund - but it's been 2 months now and they refuse to refund. They are completely inappropriate, rude, and do not care about the customer.

Don't trust a word out of anyone's mouth if it has anything to do with trials or memberships. They say one thing and do the other.

name: trista moldovan
text:
Pros: Fantastic staff- very friendly and helpful. Class format is genius. Seeing your times on a screen of your various heart rate zones means accountability. The science and guesswork of your workout is done for you.
Cons: If you don't have a working knowledge of lifting weights and using TRX equipment with proper form you could severely injure yourself.  Orange Theory is fast-paced and little to no time was given to proper form or monitoring clients during workouts. A session with a trainer might be best to make the most of your Orange Theory experience- just my opinion!
Also, I've never been in class when a warm up was given. Studio is closed prior to class so you can't warm up on your own.
Five star review for a brilliant class format.
Three star review for my achilles tendonitis.

name: Alana Salter
text: Felt so alive after the workout

name: Asante Donadelle
text:
Intense fun workouts daily.
The staff and instructors are AWESOME!!!!

name: Bob Houser
text: Awesome workout!!!  The coaches and front desk staff are all great.

name: Alisa Poole
text: Best workout experience hands down!!!

resp.text: Thank you SO much for taking the time to share your experience with us Alisa! We look forward to being a part of your fitness routine for years to come. See you at the studio!

name: Daniel Sullivan
text: This place will not tell you how much their packages are until after you give them your credit card and after you take one of their classes. They would not make an exception and shredded my application instead of telling me the prices of their packages.

name: Scarlette McBrayer
text: Love this workout, coaches and fellow fitness pals!!!

name: Melissa Hyche
text: Great workout and helpful instructors!

name: drkenross
text: Love the coaches and my fellow OTF members

name: Natalie Greer
text: The worst managment!!!! They are not willing to work with you at all. Do NOT recommend!

name: Maryann St. John
text: Just tried to cancel my subscription over the phone - not only was I told I had to give a 30 day notice, but I also had to come into the studio AND the manager needed to be present. These requirements are absolutely ridiculous. Most fitness studios will let you cancel over the phone. One reason I grew frustrated with OTF was the cancellation policy for classes, and the fact that the classes are always full. I now see it's due to the bad management behind the desk.

name: D Hodson
text: Best place to workout in Birmingham!! I love it!

name: desiree maples
text: Can't say enough great things about this place!

name: RUDBY GREEN
text: Great all around!

name: Remy Helu
text: Great workout

name: Rollin Dye
text: I travel for work and drop in to CrossFit gyms all over the country. More Fire is on of the best. Very well equipped, clean, and they are very knowledgeable about fitness. I highly recommend this gym!

resp.text: Thanks Rollin, we hope to see you next time you pass through Birmingham, AL.

name: Jessica King
text: I had my first experience with CrossFit here. Andrew, one of the trainers really took the time to show me the correct mechanics for every workout! Morefire has a good atmosphere and they make you feel like family. If you want a challenging workout this place is awesome no matter your skill level.

resp.text: Thanks Jessica

name: Zockly Glockly
text: It is dope, if you’re thinking about joining you’re already doing to much, just join bruh.

name: Staci Walden
text: Andrew and the MoreFire team are outstanding!  As a newcomer to the area (and to CrossFit) I quickly found a home and expert guidance to navigate a new path to fitness.  As a health related professional it was very important to me that the approach used was scientific and evidence based, and that appropriate supervision was available to prevent injury and maximize benefit. All of my expectations were met. I truly couldn't recommend them any higher, stop thinking about it and do it!

resp.text: Thanks Staci, I'm glad you allowed us the opportunity to be the first to introduce you to CrossFit.  It makes us really happy that you have an additional shared passion (in CrossFit), that you can now mutually enjoy with your son.  It is always great to have other health & fitness professionals around to bounce ideas off of as well. As a Registered Dietitian you give great food for thought :-). https://foodsforthoughtllc.com/

name: Justin Brewer
text: Great group of people and the most detailed and personalized instruction I have ever received, highly recommend.

resp.text: Thanks Justin

name: Patrick Harbin
text: I had absolutely no experience with crossfit prior to joining Morefire, and now looking back, I  wish I would have started a lot sooner with Andrew and his gym. Even in my limited crossfit experience, l feel I can confidently say that most gyms in the Birmingham area will have the same equipment. However, what really sets this place apart from the others, is the head trainers knowledge, experience, and coaching style. I've learned more in the past 3 months than I have in the last 22 years of traditional weightlifting/exercising, and it has been a humbling experience to say the least. Andrew promotes community and self improvement, and since day 1 of the on-ramp course he's done nothing but motivate me and taken a genuine interest in helping me reach my goals. Great dude and good gym all around.

resp.text: Thanks Patrick.

name: Carlton Adderley
text: Feel the burn!! This is a gym where you can definitely be pushed to the next level. The trainers pay careful attention to your goals, they are also great at scaling up or down work outs to maximize safety and ensure you get the most out of your time and effort. This is the gym for people who want results and are ready to work for it, and have fun at the same time.  10/10 would recommend!

resp.text: Thank you! A safe CrossFit workout to help you meet your lifestyle goals and maximize results is our passion!
